entry.content:
My journey towards üòâ ‚ÄúCat on a Cloud‚Äù üòâ
I never really had a pet ‚Äî until one trek in the UAE mountains changed that.
During the climb, a little cat appeared out of nowhere and began following me, what started as a random encounter turned into a 10Km journey together - step by step and rest by rest - and by the end, it felt like we‚Äôd known each other forever üòä

This Petoberfest really bought back this memory, and I am very thankful for this to the Devtoberfest Developer Advocates - the true legends and soul behind this phenomenal event that brings developers together and also to my journey ‚ÄúCat on a Cloud‚Äù üòç

Here is that mystical little wanderer:
mystical cat

 

The "AI Powered" mystical little wanderer

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Goods Receipt Cancellation...
entry.content:
Hello @byd,

Here is what are standard in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for cancelling goods receipts (GR) and what you should do for payment recovery and timing.

Standard: GR cancellation reverses logistics and accounting, timed by posting date and open periods, corrected with Supplier Credit Memo, tracked in GR/IR apps. SAP Help Portal-Material Documents Overview

Not standard: auto-comparing historic payments versus cancellation amounts and auto-creating incoming/outgoing payments. Would require process and workflow design

Automatic reversal when you cancel a GR

Yes. Cancelling a material document creates a reversal material document and the related accounting reversal stock or consumption, and GR/IR where relevant. Do this from the material document Cancel or Reverse or via the Fiori apps for material documents. SAP Help Portal-Material Documents Overview

Note: If no supplier invoice exists yet, the GR/IR effect is fully reversed by the cancellation itself. If an invoice already exists or was even paid, the GR cancellation does not auto-reverse Accounts Payable. SAP Help Portal-Clear GR/IR Clearing Account

Handling payment vs. cancellation amount

Not automatic. The system does not auto-compare prior payments with the GR cancellation and generate incoming and outgoing payments.

If a supplier invoice exists and must be reduced or refunded, post a Supplier Credit Memo reference the PO/material document where possible. Payment program will net it against open items; if already paid, the credit memo creates the receivable to recover from the supplier. SAP Help Portal-Creating Supplier Invoices and Credit Memos

If goods physically go back, use Return to Supplier and then post or receive the supplier credit memo that follows the return. SAP Help Portal-Return to Supplier

Posting period and timing options for the reversal

When you cancel, you control the posting date of the reversal subject to open periods. 

You can post in the current open period typical or Back-date into the original month if that period is still open.
Period control is via Open and Close Posting Periods (Finance) and Close Periods  and Manage Posting Periods for Materials. There isn‚Äôt a force into original month if closed option,closed periods block back-posting.  SAP Help Portal-Opening and Closing Posting Periods

Recovery when the vendor owes you after GR cancellation

Use Supplier Credit Memo in Manage/Create Supplier Invoices (with PO reference where possible) to document the vendor‚Äôs refund obligation and track it in AP open items and reporting.SAP Learning-Performing a supplier Returns in SAP

Useful paths (Public Cloud)

  • Material Documents Overview ‚Üí Open GR ‚Üí Cancel or Reverse. SAP Help Portal
  • Display Cancel Material Documents (library entry shows reversal behavior). Material Documents Overview
  • Manage Create Supplier Invoices (create Credit Memo). SAP Help-Creating Supplier Invoices and Credit Memos
  • Return to Supplier (process guide). SAP Help Portal and SAP Learning-Performing a supplier Returns in SAP
  • Open and Close Posting Periods (Finance) and Close Manage Posting Periods (Materials). SAP Help Portal-Opening and Closing Posting Period

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Accounts Payable Functiona...
entry.content:
Hello @byd 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, all the listed AP functionalities are available in standard public cloud. An exception is for minor extensions in integration detail or data enrichment for special regulatory cases. Find the explanations below:

  1. Automatic AP Posting can be done through standard GR/IR clearing, evaluated receipt settlement (ERS), and workflow-based supplier invoices.
  2. Payment Scheduling & Cash Flow is covered by Cash Flow Analyser, Liquidity Forecast, and Manage Payments.
  3. Due Date Change Tracking is standardly done through change longs in supplier invoices.
  4. External Integrations can be achieved through Payment Request API, Concur, and Bank Communication Management.
  5. Overseas Remittance Compliance is supported through ISO20022 payment formats and Payment Medium Workbench.
  6. Payment Hold Management is available in the payment block tracking, overdue payable analysis, and Situation Handling alerts.
  7. Have a look at the following references for more details.

The following references provide further details:

Accounts Payable Overview

Manage Automatic Payments

Liquidity Forecast

Payments and Bank Communication in S/4HANA Cloud

Overdue Payables

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Enhanced Mass Actions for High Volume Hiring

However, this doesn‚Äôt happen when you process 10 candidates at a time.

Could you clarify:
At what number of candidates does the system treat the action as a ‚Äúmass action‚Äù and trigger these notifications?

entry.title: Creating a personal development environment #4 - A custom theme for SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Creating a personal development environment #4 - A custom theme for SAP TechEd 2025

  1. #1 - Why Neovim?
  2. #2 - Miscellaneous, status line, and color scheme
  3. #3 - Vim keybindings
  4. #4 - A custom theme for SAP TechEd 2025 (this blog post)

Building on top of the previous three blog posts, this blog post will focus on creating a custom theme for Neovim, inspired by the SAP TechEd 2025 branding.

I always enjoy playing around with themes in editors and the SAP TechEd branding was the perfect blueprint to work on a real custom theme for Neovim for the first time. I had previously only changed a few colors in existing themes or applied background images via local config files, but never created a full theme that also others could actually use. So let's get started.

At first, I inspected the documentation of my beloved carbonfox by nightfox.nvim theme to remind myself of how to extend it. I played with a few colors that I got from the SAP TechEd templates and added them to the plugin configuration of the existing theme (~/.config/nvim/lua/plugins/theme.lua), which looked something like this:

return {
    "EdenEast/nightfox.nvim",
    config = function()
        require("nightfox").setup({
            options = {
                palettes = {
                    carbonfox = {
                        bg0  = "#89D1FF", -- Dark bg (status line and float)
                        bg1  = "#EBF8FF", -- Default bg
                        sel0 = "#FF8AF0", -- Popup bg, visual selection bg                    
                        sel1 = "#FFCC00", -- Popup sel bg, search bg}
                    }
                },
                transparent = true,
                styles = {
                    comments = "italic"
                }
            }
        })
        vim.cmd "colorscheme carbonfox"
    end
}

I then realized that there had to be more to it than just changing the colors of the existing palette, as a palette contains not as many colors (16) as the theme actually uses and provides (32). I noticed that because the theme also provides config files for many terminals to copy and paste into your terminal settings (for example this kitty.conf), so that your terminal and Neovim are fully in sync - and those config files had other colors in them that where not part of the palette, plus the names of the colors in the palette did not match the ones on the config file. So now I had to understand how bg0 becomes active_tab_foreground and so on. There was probably some build step with additional logic happening here. After some digging and reverse-engineering, I came up with a mapping that allowed me to test a certain color in both my terminal and Neovim, as I now knew which color in the palette would later become which color in the terminal config:

comment
    inactive_tab_foreground

bg0
    active_tab_foreground

bg1
    background
    cursor_text_color

bg4
    inactive_border_color

fg1
    cursor none
    selection_foreground
    foreground

sel0
    selection_background
    inactive_tab_background

black
    color0

red
    color1

green
    color2
    url_color

yellow
    color3

blue
    color4
    active_border_color
    active_tab_background

magenta
    color5

cyan
    color6

white
    color7

orange
    color16
    bell_border_color 

pink
    color17

After a few iterations of tweaking colors and testing them in both Neovim and my terminal, I finally arrived at a color scheme that I liked and that resembled the SAP TechEd branding quite well. To make it easier for others to use it as well, I forked the nightfox.nvim repo and added the colors to two new themes: saptechedlightfox and saptecheddarkfox. You can find the fork on my GitHub. While digging into the repo, I found that (as already suspected) the terminal config files are generated during a build step and that there is logic in place to transform a few colors to get different shades for them. You can find these files in the extra/ directory of the repo.

The new themes can now be applied to Neovim like this (notice the module now pointing to my fork):

return {
    "nicoschoenteich/nightfox.nvim",
    config = function()
        require("nightfox").setup({
            options = {
                transparent = true,
                styles = {
                    comments = "italic"
                }
            }
        })
        vim.cmd "colorscheme saptechedlightfox"
    end
}

If you also want to apply the background image (see screenshots below), you can find in the extra/ directory of the forked repo and apply them to your terminal of choice. This is what the config looks like for kitty:

...
window_logo_path background-light.png
window_logo_position bottom-right
window_logo_alpha 1
window_logo_scale 100
...

I will close this blog post with a few screenshots of the final result:

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Accounts Receivable Functi...
entry.content:
Hello @byd 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, the following applies for your AR-related requirements:

1 Customer Acceptance Reconciliation - not standard implement via SAP BTP or API-based custom process.

2 AR/AP Offset for Same BP - standard when the same BP has both AR & AP roles; manual clearing otherwise.

3 Refund for Negative AR Balances - fully supported in standard, with BCM integration and ISO20022 payment formats

4 Aging Receivables Management - standard Fiori analytical apps (F0736, F1511, F2217) cover this comprehensively.

Only requirement #1 would require a custom integration or extension. All others are standard and available in Public Cloud scope..

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Accounts Receivable Overview

Manage Automatic Payments

Aging Analysis

Situation Handling

Do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions.

Best regards 

Chris

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Matthias Stegmueller and I‚Äôm driving the product development for SAP‚Äôs Business Data Transformation Center as Lead Product Owner. My focus is to accelerate cloud transitions through SAP‚Äôs Transformation Portfolio, enabling business transformation via a unified methodology.

My Session: DT103 ‚Äì Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

 üìÖ Wednesday, Nov 5    ‚è≤ 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET

 

What you will learn about: 

Transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private can be complex‚Äîbut it doesn‚Äôt have to be. In this session, J√∂rg and me will guide you through the available transition paths, including New Implementation, System Conversion, and Selective Data Transition. You‚Äôll explore how SAP‚Äôs Business Transformation Center and integrated toolchain support a smooth, data-driven journey with minimal disruption. Learn how to leverage tools like the Digital Blueprint, System Transition Workbench, and Data Transition Validation to accelerate your move while reducing risk and cost. Whether you're a customer or a partner, this session offers practical insights, demos, and best practices to help you confidently navigate your cloud ERP transformation.

 Co-speakers: 

 @joerg_marenk 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
ST103 | Accelerating the cloud transition with a guided transition methodology
CS102 | Speed up your cloud transition: Maximize efficiency and minimize costs
CS162 | Data-driven transition guidance toward the cloud
CS803 | A journey through next-generation transformation tools

Related community topic pages: 

 SAP Business Transformation Center

 Looking forward to seeing you: 

 Don't miss the chance to learn how to secure your organization online services as well as your online customers accounts from malicious actors.  Register now and be part of these sessions

 Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

  • Did you start your journey to SAP Cloud ERP Private already? What are your current observations and challenges and expectation towards SAP to accelerate it? 
  • Which transition path did you choose (if already) and why?

Feel free to answer these questions by adding a comment in the comments section. Looking forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: Re: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition fr...
entry.content: Hi, @Slava_Aliakseyevets As you suggested, I tried using option number 2. What I tried: I used the session ID cookie (SAP_SESSIONID_AO0_100) in a GET call and received the PDF as a response. I used the user credentials in a GET call and received a positive response (code 200) but no data. In case 2, it seems that the API cannot authenticate even if credentials are correctly provided. On the other hand, using a session ID cookie to authenticate is not the correct way to use the API and is not applicable to our use case. entry.title: Re: Queue Display not supported for function /SCWM/QDECID...
entry.content:
Hi Raghavan,
I understand you have try to analyze the error but still you don't know what is missing.
You can do some additional checks as suggested below.


1. Check if the queue is stuck or inactive: Go to SMQ2 and verify the status of the LUW (Logical Unit of Work). If it's in "Ready" or "Error" state, try manually reprocessing it.

2. Use transaction SLG1: Look for logs under object /SCWM/QDECIDED_FUP_PROCESS to get more detailed error messages. This might reveal missing configuration or data inconsistencies.

3. Verify QIE configuration: Ensure that the Quality Inspection Engine (QIE) settings are correctly maintained, especially the follow-up action mapping.

4. Confirm RFC destination setup: The registered program /SPE/QUEUE_DISPLAY_TOOLS might not be correctly linked to the RFC destination. Check SM59 and transaction RZ70 to ensure the RFC destination is active and correctly configured.

5. Debug the queue manually: If the queue cannot be displayed, you may need to debug the function module /SCWM/QDECIDED_FUP_PROCESS directly to trace where it's failing.

Let me know if the issue still exist

entry.title: Re: Issue with Cost Center linked to incorrect Profit Cen...
entry.content:
Hi Chuma,

Thanks for your reply.

This is indeed also what SAP Support proposed as solution in our ticket. Unfortunately this does not work in our case. After talking to one of SAP's specialists I received the following answer:

"It seems to be a system validation and will not be possible to do the assignment. The current version of S/4HANA Cloud for asset accounting doesn't allow to assign a cost center with two profit centers, even if you assign the two profit centers in two different time intervals. The reason for that is to ensure the safety of the value for assets. The workaround would be the creation of a new Cost Center all together, with the right profit center assigned. Creating a "new" 5393 with a slightly different number and update the rest of the business processes as well."

As mentioned in the request, Creating a new cost center is not an option, considering our system landscape is built on this logic (from HR to CRM). Therefore my question remains unsolved.

Kind Regards,

Mike van Ingen

entry.title: Different version/FYV managing for preliminary and final closing on Group Reporting
entry.content:
Hello experts,
I am writing to ask for your advice regarding the following topic:

Currently, our client‚Äôs consolidation activities include a quick close (period 12) and a final close (which takes into account the entries for exceptional periods up to period 16). In particular, management accrual entries, budget integration, and estimated data are recorded up to period 12 and reversed in period 13, with subsequent updates up to period 16.

The client‚Äôs expressed need is to find a way to optimally manage the closing activities for period 12 alongside the reopening activities for the new year, while keeping the preliminary data separate from the final data.

We imagine this could be achieved by defining two separate versions. To your knowledge, is it possible to manage one version with a Fiscal Year Variant that stops at period 12 for preliminary data without considering the special periods, and another version that contains only the final data to be used for activities in the new year?

Any suggestions for a smooth and optimised management of this scenario would be very welcome!

entry.title: Re: KDM Transaction Key Not Triggering in Customizing Sys...
entry.content:
Hello @archana_raut38 

Thank you for your question.

If your MIRO is not posting did not generate KDM,  it is usually due to one some conditions not being met in the customising/test system.

Have a look at Material Account Determination , Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) , SAP PRD and KDM Question for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, the KDM transaction key is automatically triggered during MIRO only when an exchange rate difference arises between the Goods Receipt and the Invoice Posting for a foreign-currency PO. If KDM is not appearing in your test system, you will need to confirm a few details:

  • PO and MIRO are in different exchange rates.
  • Material has Price Control = V and zero stock at MIRO.
  • GR/IR is open at the time of MIRO.
  • KDM account is maintained correctly in Automatic Account Determination (SSCUI 100297).

You can test the following:

  • Create a PO in EUR with company currency IQD.
  • Post GR at one rate and MIRO at a higher/lower rate.
  • Check journal entry, a KDM P&L posting should be visible.

Once you have verified these, you can safely transport your corrected KDM account configuration to production.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: CAP Java: How to retrieve the database schema name?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
is there any chance to get the schema name of the tenant specific HDI container?
In our CAP Java application we have a REST endpoint in which we access the tenant database using JDBC template. In one of the queries we need to read from the metadata table PUBLIC.M_COLLECTION_TABLES which has also a key column for the schema name which we want to use for filtering. Therefore we need to know the schema name of the tenant specific HDI container. How can we get this information?

Best regards,
Sven.

entry.title: Change Management in SAP migration processes
entry.content:
On 9 September 2025, Marta Mota spoke about migrating to SAP‚ÄØS/4HANA and emphasized the vital role of change management within such transformation programs. This event took place in the lectures that preceded SAP Inside Track Porto 2025.

The key points she covered include:

  • The migration to S/4HANA is not only a technical upgrade but a major business and organizational change. It affects processes, roles, and ways of working.

  • Successful migration depends on preparing people and organizational culture: ‚Äúthe human factor is often underestimated‚Äù when systems change. 

  • She highlighted the need to engage stakeholders early, including executives, business units, IT, and end users, to build shared vision and commitment.

  • Effective change management involves establishing a change network or champions within business units who can act as liaisons and multipliers for the transformation.

  • Clear, tailored communication is crucial: the changes should be explained in terms of what they mean for each team and individual‚Äînot just the IT system.

  • Training and adoption are not one-off tasks but ongoing journeys: users need not only to learn the new system but to adopt new behaviors and processes.

  • She underlined that it‚Äôs key to link the migration project to business value and concrete benefits for users, so that change is not perceived as purely disruptive but as enabling.

  • Among the risks she identified: insufficient readiness of the organization, lack of clarity in process change, and resistance from users who see the migration as a threat or overhead.

  • She pointed out that change management should be integrated into the migration roadmap ‚Äî not treated as a separate ‚Äúsoft‚Äù item but embedded in the project governance, timeline, and deliverables.

In short, migration to S/4HANA demands technical excellence, but equally the orchestration of people, process, culture, and change. Ensuring readiness, adopting change agents, and focusing on user adoption help the transformation deliver the expected value.

YouTube link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KsVZA1NoJjA

entry.title: Deleted Work Order and Position ‚Äì unable to reassign
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

A contingent worker was originally hired on a work order and position. Later, he became a regular employee and moved to another position.

The original work order was accidentally deleted, and the related position was also removed. Now I cannot recreate the work order or assign the same position back to the employee.

When I try, the system shows this error:

Error: It is not permitted due to your system configuration to process this transfer.
To perform the transfer, please terminate this record and then rehire with new employment.

What is the best way to restore the position and work order data back to this contingent worker?
I‚Äôm considering purging the CWK through DRTM and then recreating him as a contingent worker, but I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs possible to link the new CWK record back to his regular employee record afterward.

Thanks,
Sara

entry.title: Re: Balance of Payments - COPE Portugal - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
Deivid... 

Pelo que entendo isso √© um formato de arquivo que se configura no PMW ou DMEE

Dentro do SAP, esta ‚Äúobriga√ß√£o COPE‚Äù traduz-se em:

a) Configura√ß√£o de um formato de pagamento (Payment Medium Format)

  • Criado via DMEE Tree ou Payment Medium Workbench (PMW);

  • O formato XML segue o schema COPE (publicado pela SIBS);

  • √â usado na transa√ß√£o F110 para gerar ficheiros de pagamento v√°lidos.

entry.title: Output message triggered even if output ignored (requirement 0000902 not fulfilled)
entry.content:
Hello,

When an outbound delivery document is generated, we need to trigger an output type [which generates an IDoc]  for ZEOR.

For this purpose, we have created a routine 902 in our system. If the required conditions, fails then SY-SUBRC set as 4 else set as 0 to trigger the output type.

Currently we are facing a problem, even after setting SY-SUBRC as 4 in routine 902, output type ZEOR getting triggered.

I checked in the determination analysis and indeed the routine is not fulfilled and ignore the output message. But the status is green and the idoc is generated.

I have added my code both in FORM KOBEV_902 and FORM KOBED_902.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: On the Redesigned Applicant Workbench, buttons for 'Upload' and 'Download' are hidden
entry.content:
On the redesigned applicant workbench, under 'CV & Documents' on an application, the buttons for 'Upload' and 'Download' are hidden (unless you hover your mouse cursor over them) in the banner that contains the candidates the name.

This KBA 3619135 - On the Redesigned Applicant Workbench, buttons for 'Upload' and 'Download' are hidden - Recruiting Management stated that this would be fixed in this release, but the issue still persists:

Resolution

Our Engineering team investigated this issue and have advised that a code fix is being developed and will be released as part of the 2H 2025 Release

  • 13th October 2025 in Preview
  • 14th November 2025 in Production

entry.title: Brazil as One of the Leading Hubs for Artificial Intelligence (2024‚Äì2025)
entry.content:
Over the past two years, Brazil has established itself as one of the main Artificial Intelligence (AI) hubs globally, standing out for its combination of public investments, expanding business ecosystem, and regulatory progress. Traditionally a leader in innovation and technology in Latin America, Brazil is now attracting international attention by accelerating the adoption of AI across strategic sectors such as finance, energy, agribusiness, and public services.

In 2024, the Brazilian government launched the Brazilian Artificial Intelligence Plan (PBIA) 2024‚Äì2028, a program with an estimated investment of R$ 23 billion dedicated to AI research, development, and infrastructure. The plan aims to strengthen technological sovereignty, foster innovation through universities, and support companies in applying AI to practical use cases, particularly in areas of public interest.

The Main pillars of the PBIA 2024‚Äì2028 are:

  • Expansion of AI research and innovation centers;
  • Tax incentives for startups and public‚Äìprivate partnerships;
  • Training and qualification of AI professionals;
  • Implementation of AI in public services (health, security, education).

This initiative positions Brazil as a regional leader in AI policy, ahead of countries like Mexico, Chile, and Argentina.

Brazil‚Äôs private sector is undergoing a phase of rapid AI adoption. By 2025, a national survey identified 396 Brazilian AI companies focused on marketing applications, reflecting diversification across generative AI, automation, analytics, and digital services.

According to a Bain & Company (2025) study, 67% of Brazilian companies now consider AI a strategic priority, a major leap from 2024, when only about 12% had active projects. This demonstrates the transition from experimental use to mature, production-level adoption.

Brazil received international investments and technological infrastructure. That's why Brazil‚Äôs consolidation as an AI hub also stems from the confidence of major global players. In September 2024, Microsoft announced a US$ 2.7 billion investment in cloud and AI infrastructure in Brazil, one of the largest technology investments in Latin American history. In 2025, Eletrobras partnered with C3 AI to modernize Brazil‚Äôs power grid using AI and machine learning, highlighting the industrial applications of advanced technologies.

These moves strengthen Brazil‚Äôs position as a regional hub for data and high-performance computing, essential for scaling generative AI and automation initiatives.

Despite major progress, Brazil still faces structural challenges. A SAP Brazil (March 2025) survey revealed that:

  • 29% of companies lack clarity on how to integrate AI into their business systems;
  • 28% cite a shortage of skilled professionals as the main obstacle.

On the regulatory front, Brazil has emerged as a key player. In 2024, the National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) suspended Meta Platforms‚Äô privacy policy, which used Brazilians‚Äô personal data to train generative AI models. This decision marked an important milestone in ethical governance and digital sovereignty, aligning Brazil with European-style data protection principles.

The main sectors driving AI growth in Brazil include:

  • Finance and digital payments: automation and predictive analytics;
  • Energy: smart grids and real-time system optimization;
  • Agribusiness: crop forecasting and climate analytics;
  • Healthcare: assisted diagnostics and telemedicine;
  • Public administration: chatbots and natural language processing for citizen services.

These industries attract investments from both large corporations and local startups, making Brazil a fertile ground for experimentation and innovation.

About the Outlook for 2025 and Beyond the trends indicate continued expansion of generative AI and process automation in Brazilian companies. By the end of 2025, it is expected that:

  • Over 60% of corporate AI solutions in Brazil will involve generative models;
  • The country will consolidate international research and training partnerships;
  • The General Artificial Intelligence Law (under discussion in Congress) will advance the national governance framework.

With growing public and private investments, Brazil is on track to become a Latin American reference in AI innovation and ethics, combining economic growth with responsible technological governance.

The 2024‚Äì2025 period marks a strategic turning point for AI in Brazil, shifting from an emerging topic to a core pillar of industrial and business competitiveness. The alignment between government vision, international investments, and technological maturity positions Brazil as one of the leading AI hubs in the Southern Hemisphere, with the potential to export technology, talent, and regulatory best practices.

At MakeValue, we develop AI-powered applications for SAP Finance, focused on enhancing financial visibility and decision-making. Our Cash Flow Intelligence App leverages data from Supply Chain, Sales, Treasury, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and real-time Bank Balances to deliver accurate forecasting and scenario simulation, ensuring that financial teams have a clear, data-driven view of their company‚Äôs liquidity at any time.

Is your company already exploring AI implementation projects? In which sectors or business processes are you seeing the greatest potential for transformation?

References

  • Reuters: Microsoft to invest $2.7 billion in Brazil
  • Reuters: Brazil proposes $4 billion AI investment plan
  • SAP News Brazil (2025): Brazil leads in AI adoption among enterprises
  • Bain & Company (2025): Artificial Intelligence Adoption Survey
  • Instituto IA ‚Äì LNCC (2024‚Äì2025): Mapping of AI Research Groups in Brazil
  • Poder360 (2024): Brazil to become Latin America‚Äôs AI hub with R$ 22 billion by 2028

entry.title: Re: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone - Part 2
entry.content:
Hi Theodore,

the Workzone service as well as the HTML5 repository are hosted on the central landscape and are consumed by the extension landscapes. This means that the hostname in the HTML5 API URLs in the created runtime and designtime destinations must point to the central namespace. Please check the created destinations and adjust them if needed. They must not refer to the extension domain.
Unfortunately there are currently no good placeholders available to be used in the MTA to achieve this and you have to fill the domain manually.

Best regards
Matthias

entry.title: Join the SAP Enterprise Support Day and Elevate Your Business Transformation!
entry.content:
Hello fellow support enthusiasts, 

The annual SAP Enterprise Support Day (November 12-13, 2025) is around the corner! ‚Äì your gateway to unlocking the full potential of SAP‚Äôs support experience. This global virtual event is tailored to help you accelerate your digital business transformation journeys with confidence. Centered around the evolving deliverables of SAP Enterprise Support, the event highlights SAP‚Äôs latest innovations in AI-driven support, smart self-services, and integrated toolchains that simplify operations and reduce downtime. 

The event fosters a collaborative environment where insights and transformation strategies converge, reflecting SAP‚Äôs vision for a seamless customer journey across its cloud and suite solutions.

Click here to see your personal message by Stefan Steinle, EVP and Head of Customer Support & Cloud Lifecycle Management at SAP SE.: 

 

Through a series of expert-led sessions offered in multiple languages and time zones, you will gain a deeper understanding of how to elevate your business transformation. 

  • November 12, 2025 I 1 p.m. EST (Spanish, Portuguese, English) 
  • November 13, 2025 I 1 p.m. SGT (Chinese, Japanese, English) 
  • November 13, 2025 I 1 p.m. CET (German, English) 

What can you expect? 

  • Transformative Support Experience: 
    Discover how SAP‚Äôs preventative support shifts from reactive to proactive, enhancing customer satisfaction and reducing downtime. 
  • AI-Enabled‚ÄØProcessing:‚ÄØ 
    Learn how AI simplifies support across cloud and suite landscapes, enabling faster resolutions and seamless access via SAP for Me. 
  • Confidence Across the SAP Journey: 
    Explore onboarding strategies that unlock value and build trust throughout the SAP lifecycle, boosting confidence in the SAP Business Suite. 
  • Accelerated Transformation:‚ÄØ 
    Gain actionable insights into how SAP‚Äôs integrated toolchain empowers you to drive innovation and speed up their transformation journey. 

Here you can find the detailed agenda! ‚ÄÉ

Register today‚ÄØand don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to gain fresh perspectives and practical insights that will empower your business transformation. This is your opportunity to learn, connect, and take actionable steps toward optimizing your SAP solutions.‚ÄØ 

Please spread the word and share the invitation with your teams. 

If you need any support, please reach out to the event organization team. 

We look forward to seeing you at the SAP Enterprise Support Day. 

Kind regards, 

Your SAP Enterprise Support Day Organization Team

entry.title: I can move documents from ArchiveLink a Document information record DMS?
entry.content:
We currently manage documents through Archivelink. Users attach documents using GOS document classes. These documents are stored in an OpenText z repository. Table TOA01 displays all archived documents with their associated business objects.

 

What we want to do is begin implementing a DMS to manage documents. We want to migrate documents stored in Archivelink via GOS to DMS-defined document classes, with their associated business objects. In our case, these are maintenance notification. We want to be able to migrate from viewing documents in GOS to viewing them directly using the DMS.

 

Could you please clarify the steps required to implement this solution? Thank you.

entry.title: Re: RSH unable to assign people on board app
entry.content:
Hi Murat,

Thanks for your question.
As already mentioned by Tim, the feature of assigning people to operations (so in theory the workers performing the task) works a little differently and is based on other data that needs to be in place. Due to the fact of RSH being developed cloud first, without any HR/HCM component present in the S/4HANA, we had to find a different way to connect a work center to the people and could not use the known HRMS link through CR02, which is also shown in one of your screenshots. Instead, we are using the so-called work center team, managed through the "Teams and Responsibility" app of S/4HANA.
So, for people to come up in the people Gantt of the Maintenance Scheduling board, a work center team for the work center the operation is assigned to needs to be set up.
Please be so kind and check the resources provided, as well as this SAP Help documentation. If all fails, please issue a support ticket to component CA-RSH-EAM.
Thanks and best regards,
Markus

How to achieve this requirement. How to show Variance on bar chart based on my Filter selection.

If I select Actual, Budget, the variance should show (Actual vs Budget) and If I select Actual, Forecast, the variance should show (Actual vs Forecast) only.

entry.title: Output message triggered even Output ignored (requirement 0000902 not fulfilled)
entry.content:
Hello,

When ever outbound delivery document is generated, we need to trigger an output type ZEOR [which generate an IDOC].

For this purpose, we have created a routine 902 in our system. If the required condition, mentioned above, fails then SY-SUBRC set as 4 else set as 0 to trigger the output type.

Currently we are facing a problem, even after setting SY-SUBRC as 4 in routine 902, output type ZEOR getting triggered.

I checked in determination analysis and indeed routine is not fulfilled and output message said ignored. But the status is green and the idoc is generated.

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to dynamically change the names and le...
entry.content:
Dear @tsuuuu,

your screenshots look like you are trying to restrict the measure via the current date. This is not the right way to get the dynamic measure texts.

The only way to get dynamic texts in a measure is via Calculation Input Controls. So you have to restrict your time dimension via calculation input control. In my example, I achieved it via the attribute "Year" of the Date dimension:

The disadvantage of this approach is, that you will have to define a second calculation input control for the second measure, because offsets are not supported. If you want to set some dependencies, you will need to use scripting. For instance, change the value of the calculation input control for the previous year, when changing the calculation input control for the current year:

You can hide the "previousYear" Input control at View mode, so the enduser would only see the input control for the current year, that influences both measures via script:

Of course, you could add a third calculation input control for the next year and add a script to fill it via the current year.

Keep in mind, that when you are using scripting, you might also consider an onInitialization script of the story, the derive the "currentYear" for instance.

Hope this helps! 

Kind regards,

Tano

entry.title: Re: View Standard Output form/report Layout in SAP EWM
entry.content:
Hello Thakur Ravinder Singh,
Please find below the step-by-step viewing of standard forms and label layouts in SAP EWM
SAP EWM uses the Post Processing Framework (PPF) to manage printing of forms and labels. Please find below to explore and configure them.

Steps
1. Understand the PPF Framework
PPF is used to trigger actions like printing forms or labels based on conditions.

Each document type (e.g., delivery, warehouse order) has associated PPF action profiles.

2. Identify the Relevant Application Object
Each document type corresponds to a specific application object:

/SCWM/TO ‚Äì Warehouse Task

/SCWM/WO ‚Äì Warehouse Order

/SCWM/DELIVERY ‚Äì Delivery Document

/SCWM/HU ‚Äì Handling Unit

3. Access PPF Action Profiles
Use transaction SPRO or /SCWM/PPFAD to navigate:

Go to: SPRO ‚Üí Extended Warehouse Management ‚Üí Cross-Process Settings ‚Üí Post Processing Framework (PPF) ‚Üí Define Action Profiles

Find the action profile relevant to your document (e.g., /SCWM/TO_PRINT for warehouse tasks)

4. Check Assigned Forms
Within the action profile:

Look for actions like PRINT_PICK_LIST, PRINT_HU_LABEL, etc.

Each action will have a form name (e.g., Adobe Form or Smart Form) assigned to it.

5. View Form Layouts
To view the layout:

Use transaction SFP for Adobe Forms

Use transaction SMARTFORMS for Smart Forms

Enter the form name (e.g., /SCWM/HU_LABEL) and preview or modify the layout

6. Check Condition Records
Use transaction /SCWM/COND to view or maintain condition records:

These determine when a form is triggered (e.g., on delivery creation, warehouse order release)

7. Test Print Output
Use transactions like:

/SCWM/PRDO ‚Äì Print Delivery Output

/SCWM/PRWO ‚Äì Print Warehouse Order Output

/SCWM/PRHU ‚Äì Print Handling Unit Label


Common Standard Forms in SAP EWM

entry.title: How to count unbooked dimension members in SAP Datasphere for coverage calculation?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm working in SAP Datasphere and I need to calculate the coverage percentage of active customers each month.
Specifically, I want to:

  1. Count all customers in my base (from the customer dimension).

  2. Count all customers who had sales in a given month (from the fact table).

  3. Divide the two results to calculate the monthly coverage percentage.

The challenge is that unbooked dimension members (customers with no sales in the selected month) are not being counted, since Datasphere‚Äôs support for unbooked members seems to be limited.

Is there a recommended approach or workaround to include unbooked members (dimension members without fact data) in the calculation?
For example, any way to simulate ‚ÄúShow unbooked members‚Äù or force the join to consider all dimension members when building measures or analytical models?

Thanks in advance for any guidance or best practices!

entry.title: Re: Operation for Deleting Business Roles
entry.content:
Hello @naoakisaruyama 

Thank you for reaching out,

Summary: In PROD, disable expire or lock users and remove role assignments, keeping roles for traceability and relying on SAL for evidence. Delete roles only if they were never used, and check for dependencies afterwards. All the above align with SAP‚Äôs IAM guidance for Public Cloud and the listed standard Fiori apps.

What to do with users who left the company

Do not delete first; expire or lock instead. In Maintain Business Users, you can remove role assignments, lock the account, or set a Valid-to date. This is the standard, audit-friendly approach.  SAP Help Portal-Identity and Access Management-Maintain Business Users

You can mass-lock unused users and skip users tied to application jobs to avoid breaking scheduled processing. SAP Help Portal-How to Lock Unused Business Users

If HR/IDP is integrated and a user shows as active, SAP documents options like lock, delete, change validity, or remove roles via IAG  SAP_COM_0093. Use lock and validity first in PROD unless it is confirmed that deletion won‚Äôt affect traceability.  SAP Support Portal-KBA-2821839 - Employee Is Terminated but Their User Is Still Valid in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Audit and trace considerations

Security Audit Log (SAL) captures security events and is available in Public Cloud; SAP notes it‚Äôs enabled by default. Use the Display Security Audit Log app for detailed evidence of changes. SAP Help Portal-Security Audit Log

Maintain clear historical connections: locking/valid-to ensures the user ID context for workflow approvals and postings, which may need to be evidenced later. Supported by SAL and change logs.

Business roles: delete versus retain.

Preferred: keep the role definition, just remove assignments from users who‚Äôve left. Manage roles in Maintain Business Roles; you can always adapt content without losing the role‚Äôs identity. SAP Help Portal-Maintain Business Roles

If you need to delete a role, for example, created in error or never assigned in PROD, make sure there are no user assignments or operational dependencies, such as responsibility teams or job users. Then delete the role in Maintain Business Roles. Functional guidance from IAM Help. SAP Help Portal

Following upgrades, maintaining good hygiene is essential

Use Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade to see what SAP changed in catalogues/restrictions and adjust your roles accordingly; you can download the change list for evidence. SAP Help Portal-Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade

Suggested PROD playbook, secure and verifiable

  • Remove role assignments for the leaver in Maintain Business Users; lock the user or set Valid-to. SAP Help Portal
  • If doing mass actions, use the Lock Unused Business Users options and skip users with application jobs. SAP Help Portal
  • Retain business role definitions unless unused; only then consider deletion. SAP Help Portal
  • For audits, export SAL evidence if needed; detailed changes are visible in Display Security Audit Log. SAP Help Portal
  • After each release, review Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade and reconcile roles. SAP Help Portal

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Question on the implementatio...
entry.content:
Hi Lukas,

Doing a quick check of the documentation and reviewing a sample in the Custom Logic app, it does not appear that custom fields are passed into the input parameters of this Badi.

However, if you have published your Custom Field and made it available in the available CDS View, you should be able to read it from the BADI using the importing parameter for the Supplier Invoice.

Something like this (I am not a good ABAPer so please work with a good developer) - disclaimer: I have not tested this ABAP code, but it should be pretty close.

SELECT SINGLE YY1_custFldInvoice01_MIH
           FROM I_SUPPLIERINVOICEAPI01
           INTO @DATA(lv_result)
           WHERE SupplierInvoice = @supplierinvoice.

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Re: RAP I_SalesOrderTP lock error on Update
entry.content:
Hello @Filo ,

I have prepared the following example shows how to update multiple schedule lines and it works as expected:

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_salesordertp
  ENTITY SalesOrderScheduleLine
    UPDATE
      FIELDS ( requesteddeliverydate )
      WITH VALUE #(
        ( %key = VALUE #(
            salesorder     = '0000002261'
            salesorderitem = '000010'
            scheduleline   = '0001' )
          requesteddeliverydate = '20251025' )

        ( %key = VALUE #(
            salesorder     = '0000002261'
            salesorderitem = '000010'
            scheduleline   = '0002' )
          requesteddeliverydate = '20251026' )
      )
  FAILED   DATA(ls_failed)
  REPORTED DATA(ls_reported).

COMMIT ENTITIES.

 

This updates both schedule lines 001 and 002 for sales order 2261. I think it is better to check your internal table dlv.

entry.title: Re: Error when trying to display APPS - Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content: Hi triminh_le181, First, I checked whether the SAP users and roles had actually been replicated in the Workzone through the IPS job. After checking and succeeding in this step, I deleted the "NavigationService" destination and created it again, making sure to enter "/oauth/token" in the fields where you insert the token link obtained by the Workzone key. After that, I ran the test and the Joule was working normally.

entry.title: Re: Error when trying to display APPS - Joule in SAP S/4H...
entry.content:
I managed to resolve the issue by following these steps:

First, I verified that the SAP users and roles had indeed been replicated in the workzone through the IPS job.

After verifying and succeeding with this step, I deleted the "NavigationService" destination and created it again, making sure to enter "/oauth/token" in the fields where the token link obtained from the workzone key is entered.

Afterwards, I ran the test and the Joule was working normally.

entry.title: Is there a way to prevent a user from creating stories but allow insight and folder creation?
entry.content:
All,

Is there a combination of permissions that can be used in a role that allows the user to create/update/delete folders and data analyzer insights but prevents the creation of Stories/Dashboards in SAC? I know a Data analyzer permission exists and also a Private and Public Folder permission that allows creation/manage but I can't find anything that would be Story specific. The use case is for end users to have the ability to create and organise their insights into folders but without having the ability to create/edit Stories.

Thanks

Kris

entry.title: Remove Relationship in SAP Mkt Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

Is there a way to remove the relationship between a contact and an account in SAP Mkt Cloud?

We enabled "Account Matching" on our Forms, and there have been a couple of wrong matches of contacts to some accounts. So I would like to remove those relationships.

entry.title: Re: Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide
entry.content:
hi,
@Timo_Wortmann 

I was able to resolve the issue by following these steps:

First, I verified that the SAP users and roles had actually been replicated to the desktop using the IPS task.

After verifying and successfully completing this step, I deleted the "NavigationService" destination and recreated it, making sure to enter "/oauth/token" in the fields where the token link obtained from the desktop key is entered.

I then ran the test and Joule was working normally.

The problem was indeed related to the Destination. Thanks for your help.

entry.title: Re: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone - Part 2
entry.content:
@matthias_schmalz thank you for such follow up! I've been running in circles for a while now. 

Here is the situation: I created a test app which only display a button. When I add it through the content manager (by creating a group, a role, etc.) it launches correctly at the following adress:
https://dev-tal-ks9oev3t.launchpad.cfapps.eu20.hana.ondemand.com/site?siteId=7a165c71-f1e5-41e6-95ce-dbb9b05c2b42#apptest-manage?sap-ui-app-id-hint=saas_approuter_argon.ui.app.apptest

when I launch it through the tile created via cdm at the following adress:
https://dev-tal-ks9oev3t.launchpad.cfapps.eu20.hana.ondemand.com/site?siteId=7a165c71-f1e5-41e6-95ce-dbb9b05c2b42#apptest-manage?sap-ui-app-id-hint=cdm_content_1.1.1_argon.ui.app.apptest

The app crashes with a cascade of errors. These are the errors I've been getting for a while. At first I thought it came from the library I was using, but this test app does not use any library, so the problem myst be coming from the deployment itself - and the way the app is accessed by the BWZ.

 

Best, 

Theodore

entry.title: Limit item with Service Entry Sheet using Self Service Procurement Fiori app?
entry.content:
Dear experts,

We are on S/4 2023 and we are trying to implement Self Service Procurement, in combination with Lean Service functionality to replace the Gui based 'advanced' apps and classic SES.

Most variants I can get to work via 'My Purchase Requisitions', except for 1: A Service limit item with SES.

We are currently using classic SES functionality with item Category D and a limit item. It's then possible to post a SES for any value you need, as long as it's lower than the limit. But when I create a Limit item via 'My Purchase Requisitions', it creates a PR item with account assignment E (Enhanced limits), but then the Goods receipt indicator is off so you cannot post a SES. When creating such a PR via ME51N, there is a trick to switch the Good receipt indicator on before entering the item category E, but this does not work via the Fiori app of course. 

Does anyone knows if it's possible to create a limit item (E) with Goods Receipt (SES)  at all using the Fiori app?

Thanks in advance.

Jasper

entry.title: Check out the Expert Guided Implementation (EGI) sessions for November 2025
entry.content:
Check out the Expert Guided Implementation (EGI) sessions for November 2025.  EGI‚Äôs are instructor led sessions.  The sessions below are designed to facilitate effective adoption and utilization of the SAP Signavio solutions.  

Important:  The links in this blog connect to the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, which requires a one-time registration.   Follow the "sign up" link below to register. 

üìå Sign up | Walkthrough video  

November 2025 sessions are outlined here.

‚úîÔ∏èSAP Signavio Adoption Starter:  Process Manager and Collaboration Hub:  Register Here.  

This course is designed to facilitate the effective adoption and utilization of SAP Signavio Process Manager and Collaboration Hub for process management and modeling.

Goals: 

  • Learn about SAP Signavio and how you can initiate your organizations transformation journey with SAP Signavio Process Manager and Collaboration Hub.
  • Gain an understanding of SAP Signavio Process Manager and Collaboration Hub, including its usage, navigation, and setting up initial configurations.
  • Acquire the skills to create process models in SAP Signavio Process Manager using BPMN 2.0.
  • Familiarize yourself with other crucial SAP Signavio Solutions integral to your transformation efforts.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

‚úîÔ∏èSAP Signavio Adoption Starter:  Value Accelerators, Process Explorer and Process Navigator:  Register Here.

This course helps you to adopt and consume the capability and usability of the SAP Signavio Process Explorer to enable business users to run in-depth process analysis. Also get insight on country- and deployment-specific SAP solution value accelerators using Process Navigator, different deployment options, countries and localization requirements.

Goals: 

  • SAP Signavio Process Explorer is set up and ready to use.
  • Have a basic understanding of Value Accelerators.
  • Understand SAP Signavio Process Navigator.
  • Understand how to Navigate through different value accelerators‚Äã‚Äã.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

‚úîÔ∏èSAP Signavio Adoption Starter:  Process Insights for IT:  Register Here.

In this course you learn how to connect your SAP System to SAP Signavio Process Insights and collect relevant data to get ready for quick process insights.

Note:  The English version of this class takes place at the end of October (10/28).  The November sessions will be held in Portuguese and Spanish. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

‚úîÔ∏èSAP Signavio Adoption Starter:  Process Insights for Business - Plant Maintenance:  Register Here.  In this course you learn how to analyze your Acquire to Decommission process with SAP Signavio Process Insights.

Goals: 

  • Understand the available data for Acquire to Decommission. 
  • Understand recommendations for Acquire to Decommission.
  • Understand how the data can be used to prepare the S/4HANA migration.

 

Stay tuned each month to learn what courses will be offered next.

Regards,
Leean De Loria - Topic Expert for SAP Enterprise Support value maps.

entry.title: Re: Attendance Quota Type
entry.content:
Hi Raf,

The development of the Attendance Quota is a major enhancement that could not be completed in a single release.

We initially approached it in a way that would ensure the enhancements were only visible after the final release of the feature. Unfortunately, we have discovered that the enhancements are currently shown in Preview. We are working to make sure this will not be the case in Production.

According to our current plans, which are still subject to change, the feature will be available in the 1H 2026 Release. At that time, you will also receive the corresponding documentation and a description of an example configuration.

Kind Regards, Timo
